AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Orona-Sanchez: involved in a previous ruling where passenger behavior was deemed insufficient to justify a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pacheco: involved in a case where passengers 'hunkered down' in the seat, considered suspicious but not sufficient for a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Lamas: involved in a comparison of passenger conduct, exhibiting more suspicious behavior than in Pena-Cantu and Orona-Sanchez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pena-Cantu: involved in a comparison of passenger conduct where behavior was less suspicious than in the current case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: Defendant stopped by border patrol agents on an interstate highway in Texas, owner of the truck, appellant in the current case, with a vehicle that had an apparent heavy load, occupants exhibited suspicious behavior when approached, vehicle was traveling at forty to forty-five miles per hour, contesting the district court's refusal to allow post-verdict discovery through juror depositions, driver of the stopped vehicle, appellant arguing against the use of the Allen charge, seeking post-verdict discovery through juror depositions, defendant in a case where the trial judge denied a motion to interview jurors, stopped on an interstate highway in Texas 115 miles north of the Mexico/United States border, driver of a truck, truck owner with a vehicle having an apparent heavy or overloaded condition, driver of the truck, makes an assertion about the passengers' actions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron: Agents who conducted the stop of Garcia's truck, applied the multi-factorial test to determine reasonable suspicion, observed suspicious behavior from occupants, used flashlight to observe vehicle occupants at night, testified about occupants' attempts to hide from the flashlight, had specialized training as border patrol agents, stopped the vehicle more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border, knew of recent smuggling activities in the area, claimed expertise to distinguish between characteristics of travelers who are illegal aliens and those lawfully present
